result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Joseph Polich

records.addlTxt: Application for Search Warrant, Affidavit, Return of Officer, Acknowledgment of Return of Officer for 2012 White Range Rover Land Rover.
Application for Search Warrant, Affidavit, Return of Officer, Acknowledgement of Return of Officer for 4165 STH 57, Sturgeon Bay.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. GPS Monitoring. No contact direct or indirect with C.G., his residence, rental property any businesses or place of employment. M.G. and R.G., residence or place of employment.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:40 AM Defendant Jonathan Joseph Polich appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Viel in court for Johnathon Polich. SPD office still evaluating if defendant qualifies. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
